spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The primarch's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Direct Control
entries: The primarch can use a bonus action to gain or relinquish control over a wrothian taker or wrothian failure within the range of its telepathy as if the primarch had targeted it with a dominate monster spell. This connection ends if the primarch or its target drops to 0 hit points, the primarch or its target are on different planes of existence, or the primarch chooses to end the connection. The primarch can only directly control one creature at a time.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Discognition
entries: One creature that the primarch can see within 60 feet completely forgets the events of the last minute. Additionally, as the target comes to grips with its senses, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Psionic Vice
entries: One creature that the primarch can see within 60 feet must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

If a humanoid target drops to 0 hit points, it rises 1 round later as a zombie under the primarch's control, unless the humanoid is first restored to life or its body is destroyed. The primarch can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

Living symbiotically alongside psi-worms wherever they are found is a species of massive, magenta fungus known as xenobloom. The fungus forms dense, thorny forests and quickly grows back when cut down, so it presents a fearsome barrier to colonists and a thriving home to psi-worms. Consequently, settlements established on xenobloom-infested planets are typically built in areas where the fungus is most sparse, though this does little to stave off the fungi's ire in the long term.

entries.name: Worm Shelters
entries: Xenoblooms provide more than just physical shelter to psi-worms: they are also excellent hiding places. It isn't uncommon for humanoids trespassing in xenobloom-dominated regions to be ambushed by swarms of worms, from which only the most vigilant explorers tend to return.

entries.name: Psionic Fungus
entries: Xenoblooms also appear to be sentient, capable of defending themselves with lashing tendrils and engaging in sudden, explosive growth spurts to engulf would-be attackers.

Although the fungus has no psionic powers of its own, it has been observed to emit a psionic field that augments the powers of nearby psi-worms. It has been suggested that the xenoblooms form a planet-spanning psychic network that enables the psi-worms to communicate with each other, though the implications of such a thing are surely too terrifying to contemplate.

trait.name: Psionic Synapse
entries: Any creature or swarm within 30 feet of the xenobloom with the ability to cast spells psionically has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Secure Roots
entries: The xenobloom has advantage on saving throws against spells or effects that would subject it to involuntary movement.

trait.name: Thicket
entries: The xenobloom counts as an area of natural difficult terrain; creatures can move through and end their turn in any space occupied by the xenobloom. However, any creature that ends its turn wholly or partly inside the xenobloom takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) slashing damage and must make a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn. Tiny creatures and swarms of Tiny creatures are immune to this effect.

action.name: Thorn Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 3d4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Grow {@recharge 3}
entries: The xenobloom increases its size category by one step, as long as it is Huge or smaller. When it does so, its current and maximum hit points increase by 16 and it chooses which spaces to expand into. Any creatures in those spaces must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be immediately subjected to the xenobloom's Thicket ability. On a success, a creature is shunted into the nearest unoccupied space; a creature can voluntarily choose to fail this save.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a Large or larger xenobloom takes slashing damage, it can use its reaction to split into two independent xenoblooms. The new xenoblooms are both one size category smaller than the original, and have half of its current hit points, rounded down.

The avia-ra hold a dizzying array of warrior-clergymen within their Congregation warfleet, from lowly shepherds which evangelize on far-off worlds, to mighty and eminent bishops which command the armada. But the rank of apologist is apart from the rest. Only specially- appointed avia-ra of great faith can take on the mantle of apologist, from which position they answer only to the Archbishops of the Sun. Though they are tasked with spreading the word of the Sun Above, as all avia-ra clergy are, apologists are also commanded to stifle darkness and suppress heresy, even within their own ranks. Their names are spoken of in frightful whispers by those who have turned their backs on the Sun Above.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The apologist is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Strike
entries: Once on each of the apologist's turns when it hits a creature with a weapon attack, the apologist can cause the attack to deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage to the target.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the apologist is wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, its AC equals 10 plus its Dexterity modifier + its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The apologist makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Avia-Ra Sunstaff (Ranged)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Avia-Ra Sunstaff (Melee)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Amoeboid mawkeepers maintain various positions on their maws, each overseeing or maintaining a specific function of the station. As a matter of course, mawkeepers are trained in the use of spells and are educated the intricacies of magical technology. If a threat should arise and the Sepulcher Knights falter, these mawkeepers are well-equipped to defend their stations.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mawkeeper is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The amoeboid can compress its body enough to squeeze through a 1-inch wide space.

action.name: Arc Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Phaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Flexible Form
entries: The amoeboid stretches, compresses, or molds its body into a static form of its choice that is no larger than 8 feet in any dimension. It can replicate something's basic shape, but not its color, texture, moving parts, or fine details. The amoeboid can't change its body's volume, nor can it move, attack, or cast spells while transformed into a static shape.

Alternatively, the amoeboid can touch a creature and assume its general form. Its size and other statistics don't change, but it gains the ability to speak and understand that creature's language, and if the target has a burrowing, climbing, or swimming speed, the amoeboid gains those with the same speed, up to a maximum of 40 feet.
The amoeboid can end a transformation on its turn (no action required). If transformed into a creature, it can only take actions that creature would be able to take.

reaction.name: Reform
entries: When the amoeboid takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a nonmagical source and doesn't drop to 0 hit points, it can immediately regain {@dice 1d4} hit points, up to a maximum of the amount of damage taken.

Functionaries, politicians, and bankers are all bureaucrats, part of the growing market of middlemen which keep the 'verse's economy ticking. Uniformly, they lack the useful skills of an adventurer, and so have no means to defend themselves or survive on an undeveloped planet, but nonetheless consider themselves important and vital to their respective stations.

action.name: Phaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.

When a Coalition marine displays great promise to their superiors, they can be promoted to a squad leadership rank. These Coalition captains are given extra training and improved gear befitting their new roles. Though they are hardly ever seen without a squad of marines nearby, they are extremely dangerous opponents in their own right.

trait.name: Close Quarters Combat
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the captain's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Impulse Pack
entries: When the captain uses its flight speed, it must begin and end its movement on the ground, otherwise it falls.

trait.name: Life Support Systems
entries: The captain wears an impulse frame, which counts as a life suit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three ranged attacks or three melee attacks.

action.name: Antimatter Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Concussion Grenade
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage and the target is {@condition deafened} until the beginning of the captain's next turn. Additionally, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or also take this damage and be {@condition deafened} for the same duration.

action.name: Concussion Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage. The captain has disadvantage on attacks with this weapon if the target is within 20 feet.

action.name: Impactor Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d12}) radiant damage if the target is within 15 feet of the captain. The impactor then overheats, and can't be used until the end of the captain's next turn.

action.name: Repeater
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Heavy Frame
entries: When the captain takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a nonmagical source, it can halve the damage taken.

Coalition marines are trained in fast-paced, hit-and-run combat using their impulse frames and close quarters weaponry to strike targets hard, fast, and without warning. Their frames allow them to operate comfortably in any environment, from frigid, airless moons, to scorching desert planets.

trait.name: Close Quarters Combat
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the marine's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Impulse Pack
entries: When the marine uses its flight speed, it must begin and end its movement on the ground, otherwise it falls.

trait.name: Life Support Systems
entries: The marine wears an impulse frame, which counts as a life suit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marine makes two ranged attacks, two melee attacks, or four attacks with its standard carbine with disadvantage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Concussion Grenade
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage and the target is {@condition deafened} until the beginning of the marine's next turn. Additionally, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or also take this damage and be {@condition deafened} for the same duration.

action.name: Ion Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage if the target is within 15 feet.

action.name: Standard Carbine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

Firm contractors can perform a variety of duties, from infiltration and hacking, to accounting and negotiations. In a pinch, however, a contractor is a deadly combatant, capable of expertly (and discreetly) dispatching foes.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The contractor has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The contractor deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the contractor that isn't incapacitated and the contractor doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The contractor makes two attacks.

action.name: Antimatter Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Gnomish Phaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) force damage.

Gifted inventors and engineers, gadgeteers are always pushing the boundaries of what can be accomplished with magical technology. They are almost always festooned with hardware components, useful gadgets, and tricked- out blasters, as well as accompanied by an AI, or some other mechanical companion, which assists them in every endeavor.

trait.name: AI Companion
entries: If the gadgeteer rolls less than 16 with any of its listed skills, it treats the result as a 16 instead.

trait.name: Overcharge
entries: A blaster deals three extra dice of its damage and its Intelligence modifier when the gadgeteer hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Wrenchinator
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Concussion Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 5d8 + 4}) thunder damage. The gadgeteer has disadvantage on attacks with this weapon if the target is within 20 feet.

action.name: Repeater
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Omni-Grenade
entries: The gadgeteer throws a grenade at a point it can see within 30 feet. Each creature within a 5-foot radius of that point must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage, or half as much on a successful save.

action.name: Gadget
entries: The gadgeteer uses one of the following gadgets:

items: Blink Button. The gadgeteer teleports up to 15 feet.
Cloaking Device {@recharge 4}. The gadgeteer becomes {@condition invisible} until the end of its next turn, as per the spell {@spell invisibility}.
Overheat Beacon {@recharge 5}. Each blaster within 60 feet of the gadgeteer (excluding those carried by the gadgeteer) overheat until the end of the gadgeteer's next turn.
Shrink Ray. One creature within 30 feet is targeted by the Reduce effect of the enlarge/reduce spell (save {@dc 14})

entries: Hegemony troopers are the backbone of the Hegemony of Man's military. Outfitted with high-quality tactical gear and trained in all manner of combat, these troopers fill a variety of roles, from foot soldiers on the battlefield, to military police on human worlds.

trait.name: Comm Link
entries: The trooper is in constant communication and coordination with its allies within 2 miles of it. It can't be surprised by any creature or object that any of its allies within range are aware of.

trait.name: Life Suit
entries: The trooper's armor contains an integrated life suit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The trooper makes two attacks with its standard carbine, two attacks with its arc baton, or four attacks with its standard carbine with disadvantage.

action.name: Arc Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Concussion Grenade
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage and the target is {@condition deafened} until the beginning of the trooper's next turn. Additionally, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or also take this damage and be {@condition deafened} for the same duration.

action.name: Standard Carbine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

Lakshay oni are elite battle frame pilots of the Lakshay defense force who can single-handedly count a hundred or more kills in their tenure. While they usually pilot Lakshayan battle frames, they also make formidable opponents when on foot, wielding their signature katanas and swarm pistols for fast and lethal strikes. Oni are outfitted with cloaked armor, which changes color and texture with their environment.

trait.name: Alpha Strike
entries: If the oni is not surprised, it has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Cloaked Armor
entries: If the oni moves 10 feet or less on its turn, it has advantage on Stealth checks for that turn. Additionally, it can take the Hide action while in lightly obscured conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni makes two attacks with its katana, three attacks with its swarm pistols, or six attacks with its swarm pistols with disadvantage.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Swarm Pistols
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The oni adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the oni must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Nothing is more critical to the nautilids than finding a source of naturally-occurring Poseidon Solution; their entire population depends on it. While many nautilids prefer to stay aboard their whorl ships, nearly all become seekers for a time, especially in their youth. Seekers comb the galaxy, meticulously searching undiscovered systems for ocean-bearing planets and hoping to find one that would become New Poseidon. With any luck, a seeker might discover some new technology to aid the search or uncover a new clue to bring their race closer to a permanent answer.

trait.name: Aqua Suit
entries: The seeker wears an aqua suit, which counts as a life suit and provides the seeker with the benefits of a {@item universal translator|darkmatter}.

action.name: Rocket Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ion Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage if the target is within 15 feet.

Whether they fly giant starliners or nimble fighters, most pilots are experts in the operation of a variety of spaceships. What they lack in combat prowess, they make up for in their ability to skillfully maneuver through the Black.

trait.name: Ace Pilot
entries: When the pilot is in the Pilot role of a ship and takes Evasive Maneuvers, it can move 1,000 feet in any direction instead of 500 feet.

trait.name: Tricky Maneuver (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the pilot can gain advantage on a single Dexterity (Piloting) check or Dexterity saving throw it makes while in the Pilot role.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Repeater
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

Every sizable starship is staffed with a number of useful, but ultimately expendable crewmen, redshirts. When danger arises, the hope is that these personnel (in their characteristic red shirts) will suffer casualties, while the ship's officers remain unscathed.

action.name: Phaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.

Clad in their platinum armor and wielding their signature energy swords, sepulcher knights are dedicated to maintaining the neutrality of the maws and the stability of the ‘verse as a whole. None can stand before a band of sepulcher knights and expect to be victorious, for the knights command a sliver of power from the sepulcher star, which they believe is bequeathed unto their order by Old Un himself.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sepulcher knight is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the sepulcher knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, or {@dice 3d8} for a 2nd-level spell slot. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} if the target is an undead or a fiend.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The sepulcher knight has an energy shield bracer.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sepulcher knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Laser Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) radiant damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) radiant damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Gamma Blade
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) force damage.

action.name: Repeater
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

Though skathári loathe magical technology in all its forms, they are nonetheless itinerant in nature, seeking out new worlds (even greatly inhospitable ones) for their clans to settle. On their migrations to new worlds, skathári nomads often wander, trusting the energies of the ‘verse and their mysterious tree-goddess to guide them to their destinations. Whenever one encounters a skathári on a maw station or in a port of call, they are doubtless one of these nomads, roaming without direction in search of a new home.

trait.name: Adaptive Metabolism
entries: The skathári takes no damage from the extreme temperatures of space and other harsh environments (see Appendix E), and it can hold its breath for 30 minutes. Additionally, the skathári has advantage on ability checks and saving throws against inhaled poisons and gases.

trait.name: Gliding Wings
entries: The skathári has a pair of membranous wings that it can use to glide clumsily through the air. When falling, the skathári can move up to 10 feet horizontally for every 5 feet fallen, up to its movement speed. Additionally, the skathári has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage taken as a result of falling.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the skathári can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Regenerative
entries: If any part of the skathári's body is amputated, but its amputation doesn't kill the skathári, it can fully regrow that part of its body in 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skathári makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Skathári Warclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

Smugglers have a rough, dangerous edge to them, even though they might seem incontrovertibly friendly at first meeting. It's in their nature to keep a blaster held under the table, ready to shoot first, in case the law or some other threatening agent grows wise to the cargo they are smuggling. Though charm is their first line of defense, few smugglers are adverse to a bloody shootout if it means they still get paid.

trait.name: Dodge Roll
entries: As a bonus action, the smuggler can move up to 15 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, ignores difficult terrain, and can move the smuggler through hostile creature's spaces, as long as it doesn't end its movement there.

trait.name: Quick Draw
entries: The smuggler has advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, it can draw or stow up to two weapons when it rolls initiative and whenever it takes an action on its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The smuggler makes two attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Magnus
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. The weapon then overheats, and can't be used until the end of the smuggler's next turn.

action.name: Repeater
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Skin of Your Teeth (3/Day)
entries: The smuggler adds 4 ({@dice 1d8}) to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the smuggler must see the attacker.

Long journeys on transport freighters and sojourns on lonely space stations mean that spacers almost never encounter natural gravity. So accustomed are they to life on spacecraft, the hazards of the 'verse become humdrum, and the strange and fearsome creatures they encounter become mundane.

trait.name: Weightlessness Training
entries: In zero gravity, the spacer suffers no penalty to its movement speed while climbing.

action.name: Wrenchinator
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d12 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

Vect juggernauts are heavily armored, and carry large melee weapons such as greataxes, rocket hammers, and mauls. When entering combat, a vect juggernaut usually leads with its embedded battlefist, charging and pummeling its enemies, pursuing all who escape, and leaving a path of destruction in their wake.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the vect moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its battlefist on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Construct Anatomy
entries: The vect is immune to nonmagical diseases, and it doesn't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

trait.name: Inflexible Mind
entries: The vect has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vect makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Battlefist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Embedded Phaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.
Vect scouts specialize in reconnaissance and infiltration. They are fitted with an arm blade and an embedded phaser, and can therefore pass as unarmed at a glance.

trait.name: Construct Anatomy
entries: The vect is immune to nonmagical diseases, and it doesn't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

trait.name: Inflexible Mind
entries: The vect has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The vect has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The vect deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the vect that isn't incapacitated and the vect doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vect makes two attacks with its arm blade or two attacks with its embedded phaser.

action.name: Arm Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Embedded Phaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.
